Class Circuit

java.lang.Object
  Circuit

public class Circuit
extends java.lang.Object

Holds the components and terminals for an electric circuit. The solve() method finds the current through and voltage across each component of the circuit. Handles dead-end branches of a circuit correctly, but may not work correctly if circuit fragments or more than one complete circuit are present. Set the instance variable "verbose" to true to display results of intermediate calculations.

Constructor Detail

Circuit

public Circuit(Circuit origCircuit)
Constructs a copy of a given circuit by adding in the same set of components. Information regarding branches, currents, voltages, etc. will NOT be copied. These can be regenerated by using findNodes(), labelBranches() and solve().

Parameters:
origCircuit - The Circuit object that you wish to copy

Circuit

public Circuit(int row,
               int col)
Constructs a new Circuit object with a grid of terminals with particular dimensions

Parameters:
row - The number of rows of terminals in the circuit
col - The number of columns of terminals in the circuit

r1 - Endpoint 1's row
c1 - Endpoint 1's column
r2 - Endpoint 2's row
c2 - Endpoint 2's column
posEndRow - Positive terminal's row
posEndCol - Positive terminal's column return True if component is successfully added to circuit; false if the component was not added

addComponent

public boolean addComponent(Component c,
                            int r1,
                            int c1,
                            int r2,
                            int c2)
Adds a component to a to a specific location in a circuit. Ordinarily this is performed only when first specifying the circuit. If a different component already exists at the specified location, this method has no effect. Updates the endpoints of the component so that it knows what terminals it is connected to. Updates those terminals so that they know they are connected to this component. If the component is a battery, this method defaults to making endPoint1 the positive terminal of the battery.

Parameters:
c - The component to be added
r1 - Endpoint 1's row
c1 - Endpoint 1's column
r2 - Endpoint 2's row
c2 - Endpoint 2's column return True if component is successfully added to circuit; false if the component was not added

removeComponent

public void removeComponent(Component c)
Searches for the specified component and if found, removes it from the circuit. This can be used in the process of desiging a circuit. It also gets used on a copy of the original circuit while identifying independent loops.

Parameters:
The - component to be removed.

removeComponent

public void removeComponent(int r1,
                            int c1,
                            int r2,
                            int c2)
Removes a component from a specified location within a circuit. This can be used in the process of desiging a circuit. It also gets used on a copy of the original circuit while identifying independent loops.

Parameters:
r1 - One endpoint's row
c1 - One endpoint's column
r2 - The other endpoint's row
c2 - The other endpoint's column

solve

public double[] solve()
This method uses several helper methods to solve a circuit via Kirchhoff's rules and linear algebra. After running it, each component will have been assigned a branch number and a current direction; each Terminal will have a potential.

Returns:
Returns an array of currents. Each current is indexed by its branch number within the circuit. Returns null if it does not find a complete circuit.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
Returns a String list of the components within each branch of the circuit, including any dead-end branches
